intro: Guatteria fruticosa, commonly known as the Mexican orange or wild orange, is a small evergreen shrub native to Central America and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by yellow-orange fruits that are edible and have a citrus-like aroma. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
